bug.author: tomzx
bug.summary: TypeError raised when opening the generated report
bug.description:
Describe the bug When using the pandas_profiling command line script, an error is raised after the report has been written to disk. <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/tom/repos/git/pandas-profiling/.venv/bin/pandas_profiling", line 11, in <module> load_entry_point('pandas-profiling==2.3.0', 'console_scripts', 'pandas_profiling')() File "/Users/tom/repos/git/pandas-profiling/.venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/controller/console.py", line 78, in main p.to_file(output_file=args.output_file, silent=args.silent) File "/Users/tom/repos/git/pandas-profiling/.venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/__init__.py", line 139, in to_file webbrowser.open_new_tab(output_file) File "/Users/tom/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/webbrowser.py", line 86, in open_new_tab return open(url, 2) File "/Users/tom/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/webbrowser.py", line 78, in open if browser.open(url, new, autoraise): File "/Users/tom/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/webbrowser.py", line 648, in open script = 'open location "%s"' % url.replace('"', '%22') # opens in default browser TypeError: replace() takes 2 positional arguments but 3 were given </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce <denchmark-code>pandas_profiling AirQualityUCI.csv audit.html </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Air+Quality>https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Air+Quality</denchmark-link>
Version information: Version information is essential in reproducing and resolving bugs. Please report:
Python version: 3.7.0 Environment: Virtualenv with only pandas-profiling==2.3.0 (and dependencies) installed
Click to expand Version information astroid==2.3.3 astropy==3.2.3 attrs==19.3.0 bleach==3.1.0 confuse==1.0.0 cycler==0.10.0 decorator==4.4.1 defusedxml==0.6.0 entrypoints==0.3 htmlmin==0.1.12 importlib-metadata==0.23 ipython-genutils==0.2.0 isort==4.3.21 Jinja2==2.10.3 jsonschema==3.2.0 jupyter-client==5.3.4 jupyter-core==4.6.1 kiwisolver==1.1.0 lazy-object-proxy==1.4.3 llvmlite==0.30.0 MarkupSafe==1.1.1 matplotlib==3.1.1 mccabe==0.6.1 missingno==0.4.2 mistune==0.8.4 more-itertools==7.2.0 nbconvert==5.6.1 nbformat==4.4.0 numba==0.46.0 numpy==1.17.4 packaging==19.2 pandas==0.25.3 pandas-profiling==2.3.0 pandocfilters==1.4.2 phik==0.9.8 pluggy==0.13.0 py==1.8.0 Pygments==2.4.2 pylint==2.4.4 pyparsing==2.4.5 pyrsistent==0.15.5 pytest==5.3.0 pytest-pylint==0.14.1 python-dateutil==2.8.1 pytz==2019.3 PyYAML==5.1.2 pyzmq==18.1.1 scipy==1.3.2 seaborn==0.9.0 six==1.13.0 testpath==0.4.4 tornado==6.0.3 traitlets==4.3.3 typed-ast==1.4.0 wcwidth==0.1.7 webencodings==0.5.1 wrapt==1.11.2 zipp==0.6.0

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tomzx>@tomzx</denchmark-link> , this error is specific to MacOS and should have been resolved in . Please reopen if the error still persists. (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/blob/v2.4.0/src/pandas_profiling/__init__.py#L137>https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/blob/v2.4.0/src/pandas_profiling/__init__.py#L137</denchmark-link> )
